Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
'Snooze
/snooz/ [FidoNet] Fidonews, the weekly official on-line newsletter of FidoNet. As the editorial policy of Fidonews is "anything that arrives, we print", there are often large articles completely unrelated to FidoNet, which in turn tend to elicit {flamage} in subsequent issues.
[{Jargon File}]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Snooze \Snooze\ (sn[=oo]z), n. [Scot. snooze to sleep; cf. Dan. & Sw. snus snuff.] A short sleep; a nap. [Colloq.] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Snooze \Snooze\, v. i. [imp. & p. p. {Snoozed}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Snoozing}.] To doze; to drowse; to take a short nap; to slumber. [Colloq.] [1913 Webster]
snooze n : a short sleep (usually not in bed) [syn: {nap}, {catnap}, {cat sleep}, {forty winks}, {short sleep}] v : sleep lightly or for a short period of time [syn: {drowse}, {doze}]
